meta.seo_description: 48-hour sprint to set up or fix SPF, DKIM, and DMARC and confirm bulk-sender compliance basics for legitimate senders. Includes objective pass/fail proof and a concise report. No inbox placement guarantees.

home.hero_headline: Fix SPF, DKIM, and DMARC in 48 hours — with proof.
home.hero_subheadline: A fast "compliance sprint" for legitimate senders: set up or repair email authentication and confirm bulk-sender requirements like unsubscribe handling. You get clear pass/fail checks, screenshots, and a short report. No inbox placement promises.

sections.title: What you get
bullets: SPF, DKIM, and DMARC set up or fixed for your sending domain(s)
Alignment and pass/fail verification (objective results)
Bulk-sender compliance basics checked: unsubscribe + sender identity requirements (as applicable)
Screenshots and test evidence you can save/share
A concise 1–2 page report with final DNS records and what changed

sections.title: Who this is for
bullets: Newsletter operators using opt-in lists
Email marketing agencies managing client domains
Small SaaS and membership businesses sending product + billing email
Ecommerce brands sending receipts and customer updates
Teams that want it done quickly without learning DNS standards

sections.title: What this is not
bullets: No deliverability or inbox placement guarantees
No "cold blast" scaling, list buying, or gray-area tactics
No spam or illicit email practices (we refuse these requests)

sections.title: How it works
bullets: You pay and we'll follow up within 2 hours
We review your current setup and identify what’s missing/broken
We publish/fix DNS records (SPF/DKIM/DMARC) with your approval
We verify pass/fail status and provide proof + a report

sections.title: The goal
paragraphs: Email providers increasingly block, filter, or distrust domains that don’t authenticate email properly. This sprint gets your domain authentication set up correctly and checks key bulk-sender requirements that apply to legitimate marketing email.
You’ll receive objective evidence (pass/fail checks and screenshots). We do not promise inbox placement.
bullets: Set up or fix SPF (single, valid record with only legitimate senders)
Enable and publish DKIM for your sending platform(s)
Publish DMARC (start with monitoring unless you request enforcement)
Validate authentication results: SPF pass, DKIM pass, DMARC pass (and alignment where applicable)
Confirm unsubscribe handling for marketing email (as applicable)
Provide a clear summary of what changed and the final DNS records

sections.title: Proof-based deliverables
paragraphs: You get documentation you can keep: record values, verification results, and screenshots. This is designed to be objective and auditable.
bullets: Before/after status snapshot
DMARC policy details documented
Header-based evidence from test messages (when available)
Rollback notes (what to revert if needed)

sections.title: Strict boundaries
paragraphs: We only work with legitimate senders: opt-in newsletters, customers, users, and lawful communications. We do not support spam or illicit email practices.
bullets: No list buying or scraping
No deceptive sender identity
No guidance for evading spam filters
We may refuse service if the use case appears abusive or non-compliant

pricing.headline: Simple flat pricing

tiers.name: Compliance Sprint
tiers.who_its_for: Legitimate senders who want SPF/DKIM/DMARC set up correctly and bulk-sender compliance basics confirmed—fast.
includes: DKIM setup/enablement for your sending platform(s)
Concise report with final DNS records and changes
Basic unsubscribe compliance check for marketing mail (as applicable)

fine_print: Turnaround is 48 hours after you provide required access (see Services/FAQ). DNS propagation can take additional time depending on your provider, but we’ll provide proof as soon as checks pass.
This service provides authentication + compliance setup with objective verification. It does not include deliverability consulting or inbox placement guarantees.
We do not support spam or illicit email practices. Requests that involve purchased lists, scraping, or deceptive sending may be refused and refunded if no work has started.

items.q: What exactly do you set up?
items.a: We set up or fix SPF, DKIM, and DMARC for your sending domain(s) and verify pass/fail results. We also check basic bulk-sender compliance requirements related to unsubscribe handling for legitimate marketing mail (as applicable).

No. We provide authentication + compliance setup and objective verification (pass/fail checks and proof). Inbox placement depends on many factors outside authentication (content, reputation, list quality, recipient behavior, etc.).
48 hours starts once you provide required access (DNS access or the ability to publish DNS records) and submit your sending details.

Best: delegated DNS access to your DNS provider. Next best: you add the records while we guide you over chat or screenshare. Worst: you forward screenshots and we provide record values only (slower and more error-prone). We never ask for email account passwords.

items.q: Which email platforms do you support?
items.a: Most major platforms that use standard SPF/DKIM/DMARC workflows. You'll list your sending provider(s) so we can generate correct records and enable DKIM where needed.

Proper authentication and DMARC reduce spoofing risk and make it harder for attackers to impersonate your domain, but no setup can eliminate all abuse. We will document your DMARC policy and recommend a safe starting policy (monitoring by default).

items.q: Can you set DMARC to quarantine or reject?
items.a: Yes, if you request it and understand the tradeoffs. By default we start with monitoring (p=none) to avoid unintended mail disruptions, then you can move to enforcement after monitoring results.
This sprint covers one primary sending domain. If you have additional sending domains/subdomains, we can usually handle them, but it may require additional scope depending on complexity.

items.q: What if my DNS host is hard to use?
items.a: We’ll provide exact record values and help you place them correctly. If your provider supports delegated access, that’s fastest. If not, we can walk you through it step-by-step.

items.q: Do you work with cold outreach or purchased lists?
items.a: No. We do not support spam or illicit email practices, including purchased/scraped lists or tactics meant to bypass provider policies. We only work with legitimate senders (opt-in newsletters, customers/users, and lawful communications).

items.q: How do I know this isn’t a scam?
items.a: You pay through Stripe (secure checkout). We never ask for passwords. For DNS changes, you can either (1) add me as a delegated DNS user, or (2) do a screenshare while you paste the records. After setup, you get proof screenshots + a short report showing SPF/DKIM/DMARC passing.

No. Please don’t send passwords. The safest options are delegated DNS access (add user) or screenshare while you add the DNS records. If you prefer, you can paste the DNS records yourself and We'll verify everything is passing.

about.headline: About {{BRAND_NAME}}
paragraphs: {{BRAND_NAME}} provides a focused, proof-based setup service for email authentication and bulk-sender compliance basics. The goal is simple: make sure your domain is configured correctly (SPF/DKIM/DMARC) and that your marketing mail meets unsubscribe expectations where applicable.
This is a narrow, implementation-first sprint — not ongoing deliverability consulting. You get objective pass/fail verification and clean documentation you can keep.
bullets: Fast turnaround: 48 hours after access
Objective results: pass/fail checks with proof
Clear boundaries: legitimate senders only
No passwords required; DNS access preferred

contact.headline: Contact
paragraphs: Questions before you buy? Send a message and include your sending domain and the email platform you use (if you know it).
Already paid? Check your email for next steps, or contact us if you need help.

sections.title: What we collect
paragraphs: We collect information you submit through our intake form and communications, such as your name, contact details, sending domain(s), email sending platform(s), and DNS-related configuration details needed to perform the service.
We may collect payment confirmation and basic billing details via our payment processor. We do not store full payment card numbers on our servers.

sections.title: How we use information
paragraphs: We use your information to deliver the requested service, communicate with you, and provide documentation of work performed (such as DNS record values and verification results).
We do not sell your personal information.

sections.title: Access and credentials
paragraphs: We prefer delegated DNS access or supervised changes. We do not ask for passwords to your email accounts. If you choose to provide temporary access to DNS tools, you are responsible for revoking it after work is completed.

sections.title: Data retention
paragraphs: We retain project notes and reports for a reasonable period to support follow-up questions and proof of completion, unless you request deletion where feasible.

sections.title: Third-party services
paragraphs: We use third-party services for payments and forms. Their handling of data is governed by their own privacy policies.

sections.title: Contact
paragraphs: For privacy questions, contact us at {{CONTACT_EMAIL}}.

sections.title: Service description
paragraphs: {{BRAND_NAME}} provides a one-time "Email Authentication + Bulk-Sender Compliance Setup" service. The service includes configuring or correcting SPF, DKIM, and DMARC records for a sending domain and providing objective verification evidence and documentation.
We do not provide deliverability consulting and do not guarantee inbox placement, open rates, revenue outcomes, or performance improvements.

sections.title: Eligibility and acceptable use
paragraphs: You must be a legitimate sender with a lawful basis to email recipients (e.g., opted-in subscribers, customers, or users).
We do not support spam or illicit email practices. We may refuse or terminate service if we reasonably believe the use case involves purchased/scraped lists, deception, or policy-violating behavior.

sections.title: Client responsibilities
paragraphs: You are responsible for providing accurate information in the intake form and for approving changes to your DNS configuration.
You are responsible for maintaining your email list practices, content, and sending behavior. Authentication does not override provider policies or recipient preferences.

sections.title: Access and authorization
paragraphs: You authorize us to make DNS changes only as required to perform the service. If you provide delegated access, you agree to revoke it after completion if desired.
We do not request passwords to your email accounts. If access is provided, it should be via delegated/limited permissions where possible.

sections.title: Limitations
paragraphs: DNS propagation times and third-party platform behavior can affect verification timing. We will provide proof as soon as checks indicate passing status, but we cannot control external systems.
Complex setups (multiple domains, multiple senders, legacy records, or unusual DNS limitations) may require additional time or scope; we will communicate if scope changes are needed.

sections.title: Liability
paragraphs: To the maximum extent permitted by law, {{BRAND_NAME}} is not liable for indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages related to your email sending, deliverability, or business outcomes.
Our total liability for claims related to the service is limited to the amount you paid for the service.

sections.title: Contact
paragraphs: Questions about these terms can be sent to {{CONTACT_EMAIL}}.

sections.title: Objective refund trigger
paragraphs: If, after implementation, your domain authentication still fails (SPF/DKIM/DMARC) for the sending domain we configured — and the failure is due to configuration within our scope — you are eligible for a full refund.
To evaluate this, we use objective pass/fail checks from standard verification tools and/or message headers from test sends, depending on what’s available for your setup.

sections.title: What’s required to qualify
paragraphs: You must provide the required access and accurate sending platform information, and you must not modify the DNS records we set during the verification window.
If failures are caused by third-party platform limitations, missing access, inaccurate intake information, or later changes you or another party makes to DNS, the refund trigger may not apply.

sections.title: Non-supported use cases
paragraphs: We do not support spam or illicit email practices. If we determine the request involves purchased/scraped lists, deception, or policy-violating sending, we may refuse service. If no work has started, we will refund the payment. If work has started, we will determine an appropriate refund based on work completed.

sections.title: How to request a refund
paragraphs: Email {{CONTACT_EMAIL}} with your domain, the date of purchase, and the verification evidence showing failed authentication. We will respond with next steps and a determination.
